newsitem.title: FRANCE: French ex-communist chief Marchais back in hospital.
newsitem.headline: French ex-communist chief Marchais back in hospital.

text.p: The health of veteran former French Communist Party leader Georges Marchais was improving on Monday after he was taken to hospital suffering from pulmonary oedema on Sunday, his successor Robert Hue said.
"The latest news I have is reassuring," Hue told Europe-1 radio. "He is under very, very serious observation," he added.
Hue said the latest ailment -- fluid in the lungs -- was linked to an operation in December when Marchais, 76, was fitted with a heart pacemaker.

A hardliner who approved of Soviet intervention in Afghanistan in 1979, Marchais led France's once-powerful Communist party, long one of Moscow's staunchest allies in Western Europe, from 1972 until he handed over to Hue three years ago.
